passages.text: ASIA- PACIFIC excl. Japan | Autos & Auto Parts Li Auto

Li Auto reported 2Q25 results with down YoY to RMB30.2bn and non- GAPP NP/NP of RMB1.5bn/RMB1.1bn, in line with our set. Vehicle margin stood at \(19.4\%\) down 0.4ppt QoQ, consistent with earlier guidance. For 3Q, the company expects deliveries of 90k- 95k units, representing a YoY decline of \(37.8\% - 41.1\%\) with i8 projected to deliver 8k- 10k units by end- Sep. Li auto also provided updates on its self- developed chip and overseas expansion progress. Details below.

2Q results came in line while 3Q guidance was soft. In 2Q25, vehicle sales contributed RMB28.9bn, with ASP lowered \(2\%\) QoQ to RMB260k. Vehicle margin declined 0.4ppt QoQ to \(19.4\%\) on lower ASP as product mix changes. R&D/SG&A expenses to sales ratio contracted by \(0.8 / 0.4\) ppt QoQ to \(9.0\% /9.3\%\) . FCF was RMB- 3.8bn (vs. RMB - 2.5 bn in 1Q), impacted by adjusted payment terms and seasonality. Despite this, the company maintained a cash rich position with RMB106.9bn cash on hand. In Sep, Li auto plans to upgrade all AD Max models across its EREV lineup with VLA AD system, and officially release i6.

Self- developed Al chip. Li Auto's self- developed Al chip, taped out and returned earlier this year, is now in- vehicle testing and slated for deployment in flagship models by 2026. It features a data- driven architecture optimized for large neural networks, delivering up to \(2\times\) performance for GPT- like models and \(3\times\) for vision tasks vs. market leaders. Developed through full- stack co- design, including the chip, compiler, runtime system, and Halo OS, it ensures seamless integration and scalability.

Overseas expansion. Li Auto officially began its global expansion in 2025, establishing R&D centers in Germany and the US, and building overseas sales and service infrastructure. All 2026 models are being developed with global compliance in mind, targeting key markets in the Middle East, Central Asia, and Europe. Despite low brand awareness abroad, the company views overseas growth as a core long- term strategic priority

Sales channel restructuring. In Aug Li Auto revamped its sales system. HQ now oversees 23 regions with new sales, service, and marketing teams driving localized strategies (i.e. promoting EREVs in the NQth and BEVs in the South regions. The company optimized store locations, rebalanced formats, and launched the "Star Plan" for rapid, low- cost expansion in lower- tier cities.

JEF view. We expect continued margin pressure on L series in 2H as more competing models will enter the market. However, investor concerns around Li Auto's BEV strategy, in our view, could be overstated. With the deployment of VLA architecture and a revamped sales channel now in place, we expect monthly sales of i8 and i6 to reach 5k/10k units, respectively, by year- end. We cut our 2025/26 NP forecasts to RMB7.6/13.7bn with sales forecasts lowered to 5k/712k units. Our PTs are revised to HKD112.8 for Li Auto H and \(\) 28.8\(for Li Auto US following the changes.

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-Us analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited
- Carving out its niche with comprehensive family car portfolio.- Product cannibalization worries are overdone.- EREV to maintain competitiveness with elimination of range anxiety and lower cost.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Demand for premium NEV SUV remains strong.- Li Auto carves out a niche in this less crowded premium BEV segment.- Continued profit margin improvement with increasing scale.- PT of US\$28.8 (HKD112.8) is based on PV of 20x FY27E earnings.

- Faster-than-expected rollout of new models.- Faster-than-expected technology development, especially in autonomous driving.- Faster/deeper decline in cost of raw materials and components.- PT of US\$37.50 (HKD148.1) is based on PV of 25x FY27 earnings.

- Weaker-than-expected sales due to competition.- Adverse change in policy on EREV.- New model launches behind schedule.- Falls behind in technology development, especially in autonomous driving.- PT of US\$16.4 (HKD65) is based on PV of 15x FY27 earnings.

1. Data security: Li Auto should value information security, protect users' personal information, and avoid data security risk through complete information security management systems and data control process specifications.  
2. Product Quality & Safety are important to auto manufacturers. To bring users healthy, safe and stable products, Li Auto implements a quality control system, and selects trustworthy suppliers.

1. Ueertake comprehensive assessment of the carbon footprint of production process.  
2. Increase the recycling rate of packaging parts from 57% to 85% for new models.  
3. Actively set CO2 reduction targets and aim to reduce carbon emissions throughout the value chain.  
4. Optimize powertrain technologies and improve power efficiency of products.  
5. Besides EREV models, aim to launch more BEV models to meet users' needs for low-carbon options and to sustain brand loyalty.

1. How do you protect your firm and your customers' data?  
2. With accelerating penetration of ADAS functions, how do you ensure the safety of vehicles?

- Better-than-expected sales volume  
- Faster-than-expected rollout of new technologies, especially in autonomous driving
Exhibit 2 - Company snapshot - Li Auto HK
Li Auto In. manufactures automobiles. The company designs, develops, and sells smart electric sport utility vehicles. Li Auto conducts businesses in China.

Li Auto Li Auto is one of the key smart EV makers in China. The company designs, develops, manufactures, and sells premium smart electric SUVs. Li Auto is the first to successfully commercialize extended- range EVs in China. The company's first model, Li One, was introduced in Nov 2019. The company leverages its in- house technology, focusing on range extension, smart technology, and autonomous driving solutions. The company also aims to expand its product line by developing new vehicles to target a broader consumer base.

PT of US \(28.8 (HKD112.8))\) is based on PV of 20x FY27E earnings. Risks: 1) intensifying competition in China's NEV market, 2) adverse changes in policy towards EREV, and 3) setbacks in autonomous driving development

PT of US \(28.8 (HKD112.8))\) is based on PV of 20x FY27E earnings. Risks: 1) intensifying competition in China's NEV market, 2) adverse changes in policy towards EREV, and 3) setbacks in autonomous driving development
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period.

The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10 is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus 20% within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) 10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus 20% or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Li Auto Inc (2015 HK: HK\$91.40, BUY)
